humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report provides the tumor size for the invasive lobular carcinoma, which is between 7 and 9 cm. Based on the rules provided, a T3 tumor is more than 5 cm. Since the tumor size is between 7 and 9 cm, the T stage is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue. In this pathology report, the tumor size is described as being between 7 and 9 cm (70% tumor nuclei). This falls within the criteria for a T3 stage tumor, which is defined as a tumor that is greater than 5 cm in size but not more than 10 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
